com.xhive.util.interfaces
Interface XhiveTransformerIf

public interface XhiveTransformerIf

Applies an XSLT transformation to a document.

The output can be either a String or a Document.

Besides the normal functionality of XSLT, there are some X-Hive/DB specific extensions:

  • In document(...) statements in selections, you may look up information in X-Hive/DB with the format: 
    xhive:/path/to/library/or/document[#xquery]
    The query is optional, but then you must point to a document. In case a query is specified, only the first result will be used. Example: 
    <xsl:apply-templates select="document('xhive:/plays#//ACT[1]')"/>
  • In <xsl:import ...> and <xsl:include ...>, you may refer to stylesheets in the database, e.g. 
    <xsl:import href="xhive:/stylesheets/play.xsl"/>

An instance of this interface can be acquired through com.xhive.XhiveDriverFactory.getDriver().getTransformer()

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Method Detail

transformToString

java.lang.String transformToString(Node xmlSource,
                                   Document xslSource)
Transform a document using XSLT, producing String output.

Parameters:
xmlSource - an XML node that acts as the root of the transformation input.
xslSource - an XSLT document that contains the template rules. This document should be namespace-aware (for example, it should be parsed with namespaces enabled)
Returns:
The transformed output (in String format).
Throws:
XhiveException.TRANSFORM_EXCEPTION - Raised if there are any problems during transformation.

transformToDocument

Document transformToDocument(DOMImplementation docCreator,
                             Node xmlSource,
                             Document xslSource)
Transform a document using XSLT, producing Document output.

Parameters:
docCreator - the DOMImplementation to use for creation of the result document. For example XhiveLibraryIf objects can be used for this.
xmlSource - an XML node that acts as the root of the transformation input.
xslSource - an XSLT document that contains the template rules. This document should be namespace-aware (for example, it should be parsed with namespaces enabled)
Returns:
The transformed output in a Document.
Throws:
XhiveException.TRANSFORM_EXCEPTION - Raised if there are any problems during transformation.
Since:
version 1.1

transformToStream

void transformToStream(Node xmlSource,
                       Document xslSource,
                       java.io.Writer writer)
Transform a document using XSLT, writing the output to the supplied writer.

Parameters:
xmlSource - an XML node that acts as the root of the transformation input.
xslSource - an XSLT document that contains the template rules. This document should be namespace-aware (for example, it should be parsed with namespaces enabled)
writer - the writer the output has to be written to
Throws:
XhiveException.TRANSFORM_EXCEPTION - Raised if there are any problems during transformation.
